intro: Tithymalus maddenii, commonly known as the Maden's tithymalus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates with adequate sunlight. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tithymalus maddenii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
